intro: Haplopappus retinervius, commonly known as the slender pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a soft, hairy texture that aids in water retention. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and are pollinated primarily by insects.
